comments_since_last_sample.body: Don't they have a permanent set up in the Namib desert that plays Africa on repeat with a solar powered iPod and speaker system? I wouldn't call them underrated.
Their song Africa is god damn annoying I'd rather listen to pumped up kicks Tongo version for 24 hours.

They actually have a wicked catalog and are a heavier band than most think. When I tell people Toto also does "Hold The Line" they are really surprised. The funny part about "Africa" is one of the band members pitched the song to the rest of the band and they weren't really into it and felt it wasn't their style. They said why not and put it towards the end of the album anyway....the rest is history. It almost sucks that people associate that song as their sound!
Underrated?? They have multiple gold and platinum albums. Seems pretty well rated.
Isn't one of the band members the son of John Williams?
Like Steely Dan, they are definitely a musicians band that became a commercial success as well. Steve Lukather is by far the most underrated guitarist of all time!!!
I’ll Be Over You    Great tune and I think Michael McDonald contributed.

"pretty underrated" = 12 million monthly listeners on spotify

???????????
The Boz Scaggs album - Silk degrees has most of Toto playing, also.
Love 'em! They also did the soundtrack for the original 1984 movie, Dune

You can't mention Toto and not Africa. It is the first song i remember in my life back in 1984 or something, exept my mothers lullabies. Been trying to listen to their stuff, but it doesn't catch my attention, Africa is a song i love though.
